medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in their usual state of health 1 day prior to admission when they experienced a sudden onset of dull, strong sub-sternal chest pain associated with nausea and diarrhea. The pain was constant, aching, and worse with sitting up. Shortly after, the pain transitioned to an epigastric aching pain without radiation. Symptoms included loose, non-bloody stools and an episode of non-bloody emesis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of cholelithiasis, cerebrovascular accident (CVA), bladder cancer surgically treated, right hip fracture s/p right hemiarthroplasty, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, mild CVA, chronic kidney disease (CKD), osteoarthritis (OA), deep vein thrombosis (DVT) during prolonged hospitalization for bladder cancer.
